data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "Inspection, Serialization, Cloning"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

As part of the [push for better documentation](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestone/7), write an article that explains how an object is dissected by Duality in order to display it in the Inspector, serialize or clone it.
### Analysis
- What are fields, what are properties?
- Object Inspector
  - Requirements for being displayed
  - Attributes to change behavior
  - Custom editors
- Serialization
  - Where is serialization used?
  - Roughly, how does serialization work?
  - What is supported, what isn't?
  - Attributes to change behavior
- Cloning
  - Where is cloning used?
  - Roughly, how does cloning work?
  - Attributes to change behavior

data.title: Exception When Running a Temporary Scene in the Sandbox and Hot-Reloading Core Plugins

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

When hot-reloading core plugins while running the Sandbox mode in a Scene that has never been saved anywhere, there will be an exception when leaving Sandbox mode due to an attempt to return to a (now destroyed) temporary Scene.
### Attachments

```
[Edit] ERR: An error occurred: ArgumentException: Can't switch to Scene '' because it doesn't seem to exist.
            Parameter name: scene
            CallStack:
               at Duality.Resources.Scene.SwitchTo(ContentRef`1 scene, Boolean forceImmediately) in c:\Stuff\svn\Projects\Duality\master\Duality\Resources\Scene.cs:line 155
               at Duality.Editor.Sandbox.Stop() in c:\Stuff\svn\Projects\Duality\master\DualityEditor\Sandbox.cs:line 158
               at Duality.Editor.Forms.MainForm.actionStopSandbox_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e) in c:\Stuff\svn\Projects\Duality\master\DualityEditor\Forms\MainForm.cs:line 585
               at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.RaiseEvent(Object key, EventArgs e)
               at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton.OnClick(EventArgs e)
               at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.HandleClick(EventArgs e)
               at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.HandleMouseUp(MouseEventArgs e)
               at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.OnMouseUp(MouseEventArgs mea)
               at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WmMouseUp(Message& m, MouseButtons button, Int32 clicks)
               at System.Windows.Forms.Control.WndProc(Message& m)
               at System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.WndProc(Message& m)
               at System.Windows.Forms.NativeWindow.Callback(IntPtr hWnd, Int32 msg, IntPtr wparam, IntPtr lparam)
```

data.title: Fix invisible name of interfaces in lists

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.title: Object Visibility Filter in Camera View Remembers Filtering for Non-Existent / Invalid Component Types

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
_New Issue Text_

As described below, it is possible to select a Component for filtering in the Camera View, then delete the Component type entirely, rebuild the plugin and still have the (now invalid) filtering active, not displaying any object. This is likely also a problem even for still existing types after plugin reload, since the stored `Type` instances will no longer be valid.

---

_Original Issue Text:_

Right now, to hide a gameobject, we have to select all of its components. This is annoying because if I want to hide all my SpriteRenderers, I'll have to hide Transforms too for example.

How to fix this ? 
- easiest option : hide a gameoject if one of its component is hidden
- hardest but maybe best option : make it so we can hide components separately. For example, being able to hide SpriteRenderers while keeping all RigidbodyRenderer.

By the way, is it even useful to see in the list components that doesn't render anything ?

data.title: Investigate Potential Editor Bug on Editor Plugin Init Failure

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

As described [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?p=5974#p5974), there might be an editor instability that is caused by an editor plugin failing to initialize. Investigate this, as well as potential related problems mentioned in the forum thread.

data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "The Duality Rendering Pipeline"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

As part of the [push for better documentation](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestone/7), write an article that gives an overview on how the rendering pipeline works in Duality.
### Analysis
- End-to-end overview.
- Camera, Renderer, DrawDevice, Batching, Backend Submit
- Sample: Using DrawDevice manually
- Visibility Groups, Bounding Radius
- Transformation (PreprocessCoord, Camera Rotation)

data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "How to Use Duality with Version Control"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

As part of the [push for better documentation](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestone/7), write an article on how to set up a Duality project in version control.
### Analysis
- Duality as a self-installing application - and how to use that in version control.
- The minimal set of required binaries for self install.
- What should be version-controlled, what shouldn't, and why.
- A .gitignore sample file.

data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "Custom Launchers / Host Applications"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

As part of the [push for better documentation](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestone/7), write an article on how to implement a custom launcher or host application.
### Analysis
- What a launcher does.
- A minimal launcher implementation.
- A WinForms / GLControl host application.

data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "How to Use Custom Renderers"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

As part of the [push for better documentation](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestone/7), write an article on how to use custom renderers in Duality.
### Analysis
- The `ICmpRenderer` interface.
- The `Renderer` base class.
- Easy approach using `Canvas`.
- Advanced approach using `IDrawDevice` directly.
- Sample: Implementing an HUD renderer.

data.title: Write a Wiki Article on "How to Use Internal / External Libraries"

milestone.title: Learning Curve
milestone.description: Improving the documentation of Duality and making it easier for new users to use and join the project.

data.body:
### Summary

As part of the [push for better documentation](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestone/7), write an article on how to use external libraries in Duality, as well as depend on plugins.
### Analysis
- Different types of libraries, requirements, plugin vs. non-plugin
- Adding a reference to the library
- Which files go into which folder
- Non-PCL libraries
- Native libraries

data.title: TypeLoadException when editor wants to update packages

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
Today I started the editor on my laptop:
1. The editor stuck in a "bootloop". The editor downloaded the packages, copied them and downloaded them again... over and over again.
2. I downloaded a fresh Duality-Zip and deleted all duality-files in my project folder. The editor downloaded all necessary files again.. and doesn't start anymore.
The eventviewer prints this stracktraces:

```
Application: DualityEditor.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception
   at System.Diagnostics.Process.StartWithShellExecuteEx(System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo)
   at System.Diagnostics.Process.Start(System.Diagnostics.ProcessStartInfo)
   at Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.ApplyUpdate(Boolean)
   at Duality.Editor.Program.Main(System.String[])
```

```
Application: DualityEditor.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.TypeLoadException
   at Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.ApplyUpdate(Boolean)
   at Duality.Editor.Program.Main(System.String[])
```

Fixes #404 

But will leave a weird Tile palette 
![bug_funny](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3697923/19364527/d42de880-918e-11e6-8556-b002c4b69d5e.gif)

data.title: Allow to disable AutoSorting

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
The PropertyGrid now has a button to toggle sort by name - actually it works only for editors derived from MemberwisePropertyEditor, such as ComponentProprertyEditor and ResourcePropertyEditor.
Not sure if the tooltip on the new button is clear enough.

Requires https://github.com/AdamsLair/winforms/pull/2

EDIT: please take care of .csproj files, as I had to reference the modified AdamsLair.WinForms dlls on my machine in order to create this feature.

data.title: Changed 'TimeFreeze' into boolean
data.body:
In this pull request the **timefreeze** member (int) is now a boolean.
On top of that you can check with a public property (get), if the time is now frozen or not.

data.title: Input Detected In Gameview But Not Sceneview
NullReferenceException in FarseerDuality when spliting up a Shape with the CuttingTools

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I tried to split up a shape of a Rigidbody with the "CuttingToools" from  Farseer.
As soon as I split it up, I've got this NullReferenceException:

```
[Edit] Error:   An error occurred: NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
CallStack:
   at FarseerPhysics.Dynamics.World.ProcessRemovedBodies() in c:\Stuff\svn\Projects\AdamsLair.FarseerDuality\Dynamics\World.cs:line 610
   at FarseerPhysics.Dynamics.World.ProcessChanges() in c:\Stuff\svn\Projects\AdamsLair.FarseerDuality\Dynamics\World.cs:line 411
   at FarseerPhysics.Dynamics.World.Step(Single dt) in c:\Stuff\svn\Projects\AdamsLair.FarseerDuality\Dynamics\World.cs:line 639
   at Duality.Resources.Scene.<Update>b__8() in c:\projects\duality\Duality\Resources\Scene.cs:line 473
   at Duality.DualityApp.EditorGuard(Action action) in c:\projects\duality\Duality\DualityApp.cs:line 983
```

My code:

``` CSharp
if (keyboard.KeyHit(Key.B))
{
    var world = Scene.PhysicsWorld;
    CuttingTools.Cut(world, mousePosition.Xy, Vector2.Zero, 2f);
}
```

data.title: Define the maximum size of lists to avoid an OutOfMemoryException in the propertyeditor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

When you create a new List<T> in the PropertyEditor and set the size of the list to an unusual size (e.g. 20023), the editor throws an OutOfMemoryException.

data.title: Removed camera rotation in CameraView

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body: as discussed in issue #371

data.title: Cleanup DrawBatch.Append/JIT Logic

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

The current Append logic for draw batches is a bit of a mess, partially for compatibility reasons, partially because there hasn't been a lot of engineering in there for a while. Clean it up, refactor and improve performance where possible.
### Analysis
- Make sure appending two batches does not put the resulting one into the Large Object Heap.
- Also, consider introducing a proper size limit for batches, so we don't get the overhead of copying large arrays.
- Check if an array resize needs to occur for merging two batches. If not, the merge is essentially free and can be done regardless of array size considerations.
- Is there a reasonable way to streamline append logic for better performance, especially AppendJIT?

data.title: Introduce Need-to-Click-Apply Notice in Tileset Editor

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

The need for clicking the `Apply` button in the Tileset editor is often overlooked because it's not the usual way things work in the Duality editor. In order to give users an additional hint, add a blue info text next to the Apply / Revert buttons that will appear when the Tileset has been changed. Should be similar to the "Apply Updates" text in the package manager dialog.
